headline: BlackRock Private Credit Write Down Puts Valuations And Dividend Risks In Focus
summary: BlackRock reported a 19% net asset value decline in its publicly traded private credit fund, BlackRock TCP Capital Corp., driven mainly by issuer specific issues. The write down has sharpened attention on risk controls and valuation practices across the broader private credit market. Regulators and investors are focusing more closely on how managers assess and report the value of less liquid credit holdings. For investors following BlackRock (ticker NYSE:BLK), this fund specific development...

headline: Bitcoin price plunges below $80,000 as $1.6b liquidation wave intensifies selloff
summary: Bitcoin is now below $80,000 per coin. The leading digital asset over a one-year period has shed more than 25% of its value. Crypto markets have struggled to recover since the October 10 liquidation event.

headline: Investors Pull Nearly $818 Million From Bitcoin ETFs as Cryptocurrency Tanks
summary: Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) experienced a substantial one-day reversal last week. Investors pulled out nearly $818 million as Bitcoin’s price plummeted to a nine-month low. Data indicated that Bitcoin ETFs registered net daily outflows of $817.87 million on January 29. This pushed January into an overall negative zone. However, the cumulative net inflows since the inception of Bitcoin ETFs remained significant at $55.52 billion. headline: 2 Bitcoin ETFs to Avoid—and 1 to Watch in 2026
summary: As crypto prices continue to lag, two spot ETFs are charging elevated expense ratios that aren’t justified by their performances, while one offers a bargain.

headline: The Exit Rush Is Over for Nontraded BDCs. Cash Keeps Coming Into Private Credit.
summary: The once-hot business of private credit got ice buckets of bad news in recent months, with the publicized failures of some borrowers.  Just last week,  BlackRock  disclosed a 19% write-down in the net asset value of the loans owned at  BlackRock TCP Capital  one of the business-development companies that private-credit firms market to individual investors.  Most of the good-sized BDCs have diverse portfolios and credit loss histories that are as good or better than other debt categories.
